clauses.raw_text: "Availability" means the percentage of time during each Contract Year that the Facility is capable of delivering Energy to the Delivery Point.

normalized_payload.calculation_method: percentage of time facility capable of delivering energy

clauses.raw_text: "Commercial Operation Date" or "COD" means the date on which the Facility achieves Commercial Operation as certified by the Independent Engineer.
clauses.notes: Key milestone definition requiring independent certification

clauses.raw_text: "Guaranteed Capacity" means 50 MW AC measured at the Delivery Point.
clauses.notes: Capacity guarantee definition with specific measurement requirements

clauses.raw_text: The obligations of Buyer under this Agreement shall be subject to the satisfaction of the following conditions precedent on or before the Target COD: (a) Seller shall have obtained all required Permits; (b) Seller shall have delivered the Performance Security; (c) The Facility shall have achieved Mechanical Completion; (d) Seller shall have obtained all required interconnection approvals from the Transmission Provider.

conditions_list: Seller obtains interconnection approvals from Transmission Provider
normalized_payload.failure_consequences: Buyer obligations do not become effective

clauses.notes: Four specific conditions precedent all assigned to Seller

clauses.raw_text: The obligations of Seller under this Agreement shall be subject to Buyer providing the Site Lease in form and substance acceptable to Seller.

conditions_list: Buyer provides Site Lease in acceptable form
normalized_payload.approval_standard: form and substance acceptable to Seller
normalized_payload.failure_consequences: Seller obligations do not become effective

clauses.notes: Single condition precedent assigned to Buyer with subjective approval standard

clauses.raw_text: Buyer shall pay Seller for all Energy delivered to the Delivery Point at the Contract Price of $45.00 per MWh for the first Contract Year, subject to annual escalation.
clauses.notes: Fixed base rate with annual escalation referenced

clauses.raw_text: The Contract Price shall escalate annually by 2.0% beginning on the first anniversary of the Commercial Operation Date.
clauses.notes: Annual 2% escalation starting one year after COD

clauses.raw_text: Buyer agrees to purchase, or pay for if not taken, a minimum of 80% of the Expected Annual Energy Output in each Contract Year ("Take-or-Pay Obligation").
Seller guarantees that the Facility shall achieve an annual Availability of at least 95% ("Guaranteed Availability").
Seller guarantees that the Facility shall achieve a minimum Performance Ratio of 80% during each Contract Year.
The parties acknowledge that the Facility output may degrade over time. Seller guarantees that annual degradation shall not exceed 0.5% per year.

If the Facility's annual Availability falls below the Guaranteed Availability, Seller shall pay Buyer liquidated damages equal to $50,000 per percentage point below 95%, up to a maximum of $500,000 per Contract Year.
clauses.notes: $50k per percentage point below 95% availability, capped at $500k annually

clauses.raw_text: If Commercial Operation is not achieved by the Target COD, Seller shall pay Buyer delay liquidated damages of $10,000 per day, up to a maximum of 180 days.

normalized_payload.trigger_event: failure to achieve COD by Target COD

clauses.notes: $10k per day delay damages capped at 180 days ($1.8M total)

clauses.raw_text: For each percentage point that the actual Performance Ratio falls below the guaranteed 80%, Seller shall pay Buyer $25,000 per Contract Year.
clauses.notes: $25k per percentage point below 80% performance ratio annually

clauses.raw_text: Prior to the commencement of construction, Seller shall deliver to Buyer a letter of credit in the amount of $2,500,000 from a bank with a credit rating of at least A- from S&P or equivalent.

normalized_payload.issuer_requirements: bank with credit rating of at least A- from S&P or equivalent

clauses.notes: $2.5M letter of credit from A- rated bank required before construction

clauses.raw_text: The Performance Security shall be reduced by 50% upon achievement of COD and fully released after the second anniversary of COD, provided no Events of Default have occurred.

release_conditions: Full release after second anniversary of COD

clauses.notes: Staged release: 50% at COD, remainder at COD+2 years if no defaults

clauses.raw_text: (a) Failure to achieve COD within 180 days of the Target COD; (b) Failure to maintain the Performance Security as required; (c) Material breach of any representation, warranty, or covenant; (d) Bankruptcy or insolvency of Seller.

owner_default_events: Failure to achieve COD within 180 days of Target COD
Material breach of representation, warranty, or covenant

clauses.notes: Four seller default events including 180-day COD delay threshold

clauses.raw_text: (a) Failure to make undisputed payments within 30 days of the due date; (b) Material breach of any representation, warranty, or covenant; (c) Bankruptcy or insolvency of Buyer.

buyer_default_events: Failure to make undisputed payments within 30 days of due date
Material breach of representation, warranty, or covenant

clauses.notes: Three buyer default events including 30-day payment default threshold

clauses.raw_text: The non-defaulting Party shall provide written notice of any Event of Default. The defaulting Party shall have 30 days to cure (or 60 days if the cure requires more time and diligent efforts are being made).

normalized_payload.extended_cure_condition: cure requires more time and diligent efforts are being made

clauses.notes: Standard 30-day cure period, extendable to 60 days with diligent efforts

clauses.raw_text: Upon the occurrence of an Event of Default that is not cured within the applicable cure period, the non-defaulting Party may terminate this Agreement.
clauses.notes: Termination right for non-defaulting party after cure period expires

clauses.raw_text: "Force Majeure" means any event beyond the reasonable control of a Party, including acts of God, war, terrorism, strikes, natural disasters, and changes in law.

normalized_payload.control_standard: beyond reasonable control of a Party

clauses.notes: Comprehensive FM definition including specific examples

clauses.raw_text: A Party's performance shall be excused to the extent prevented by Force Majeure, provided that the affected Party gives prompt notice and uses commercially reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects.

normalized_payload.performance_excuse: to the extent prevented by Force Majeure

clauses.notes: Performance excused with prompt notice and mitigation requirements

clauses.raw_text: Seller shall operate and maintain the Facility in accordance with Prudent Utility Practices and manufacturer recommendations.

normalized_payload.maintenance_standard: Prudent Utility Practices and manufacturer recommendations

clauses.notes: Seller responsible for O&M per industry standards and OEM recommendations

clauses.raw_text: Seller shall schedule major maintenance during periods of low solar irradiance and provide Buyer at least 30 days advance notice.
clauses.notes: 30-day advance notice required for major maintenance, scheduled during low irradiance

clauses.raw_text: Seller shall notify Buyer within 24 hours of any unscheduled outage and provide regular updates on restoration efforts.
clauses.notes: 24-hour notification requirement for unscheduled outages with regular updates

clauses.raw_text: Seller shall comply with all applicable environmental laws and maintain all required environmental permits.
clauses.notes: Seller responsible for environmental law compliance and permit maintenance

clauses.raw_text: Each Party shall obtain and maintain all regulatory approvals necessary for the performance of its obligations under this Agreement.

normalized_payload.approval_scope: all regulatory approvals necessary for performance of obligations

clauses.notes: Both parties responsible for obtaining and maintaining necessary regulatory approvals

clauses.raw_text: Seller shall invoice Buyer monthly for all Energy delivered during the preceding month, with payment due within 30 days of invoice receipt.
Any amounts not paid when due shall bear interest at the prime rate plus 2% per annum.
clauses.notes: Late payment interest at prime + 2% annually

clauses.raw_text: This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Illinois.
clauses.notes: Illinois state law governs the agreement

clauses.raw_text: Any dispute shall be resolved through binding arbitration under AAA Commercial Arbitration Rules.
clauses.notes: Binding arbitration under AAA Commercial Rules for dispute resolution

clauses.raw_text: Neither Party may assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, except to an Affiliate or in connection with a merger or acquisition.

assignment_exceptions: assignment in connection with merger or acquisition

clauses.notes: Assignment restricted except to affiliates or in M&A transactions

clauses.raw_text: Each Party shall maintain the confidentiality of this Agreement and all confidential information received from the other Party.

confidentiality_scope: confidential information received from other Party

clauses.notes: Mutual confidentiality obligations for agreement and confidential information

clauses.raw_text: All notices shall be in writing and sent to the addresses specified in Exhibit A.
clauses.notes: Written notices required to addresses in Exhibit A

"Commercial Operation Date" or "COD" means the date on which the Facility achieves Commercial Operation as certified by the Independent Engineer.
"Guaranteed Capacity" means 50 MW AC measured at the Delivery Point.

The Contract Price shall escalate annually by 2.0% beginning on the first anniversary of the Commercial Operation Date.
Buyer agrees to purchase, or pay for if not taken, a minimum of 80% of the Expected Annual Energy Output in each Contract Year ("Take-or-Pay Obligation").
Seller guarantees that the Facility shall achieve an annual Availability of at least 95% ("Guaranteed Availability").
Seller guarantees that the Facility shall achieve a minimum Performance Ratio of 80% during each Contract Year.
Seller guarantees that annual degradation shall not exceed 0.5% per year.

If the Facility's annual Availability falls below the Guaranteed Availability, Seller shall pay Buyer liquidated damages equal to $50,000 per percentage point below 95%, up to a maximum of $500,000 per Contract Year.
If Commercial Operation is not achieved by the Target COD, Seller shall pay Buyer delay liquidated damages of $10,000 per day, up to a maximum of 180 days.
clauses.notes: COD delay liquidated damages with 180-day cap

Prior to the commencement of construction, Seller shall deliver to Buyer a letter of credit in the amount of $2,500,000 from a bank with a credit rating of at least A- from S&P or equivalent.
The Performance Security shall be reduced by 50% upon achievement of COD and fully released after the second anniversary of COD, provided no Events of Default have occurred.
